Copper - Individual Market Analysis

CoT signals and diagnostics for Copper futures.

As of 2025-11-25

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • Copper CoT data for 2025-11-25 shows hedgers holding an extreme net short position at -31.35% of Open Interest [Source: Copper_CoT_Signals.html].
  • Speculators are moderately long at 24.65% OI, but not at a 1-year extreme [Source: Copper_CoT_Signals.html].
  • The signal indicates high market tension with no clear immediate reversal, despite extreme hedger positioning.

Key Dynamics:

  • Hedgers are the market controller, with their net short position (-2.12 z-score) at a 1-year extreme [Source: Copper_CoT_Signals.html].
  • Speculative long positioning (1.82 z-score) is elevated, reflecting sustained buying interest.
  • The 4-week flow indicates continued speculative Long_Build (1.86 strength) [Source: Copper_CoT_Signals.html].
  • Despite deep hedger shorts and high positioning tension, the reversal signal currently remains neutral.

Macro Relevance:

  • This signal informs **commodity pricing dynamics and global industrial demand**.
  • As a key industrial metal, Copper CoT tends to be a **mid-cycle** indicator, reflecting supply-demand balances and production outlooks.
  • Extreme hedger short positioning can indicate fundamental concerns about future price weakness or increased supply, interacting with broader **global growth** [Source: global_growth_group] and **inflation signals** [Source: us_inflation_group].

Data & References:

  • Copper_CoT_Signals (Latest: 2025-11-25) [Source: Copper_CoT_Signals.html]
  • Most influential datapoints: Hedger_zscore, Spec_Net_%OI, hedger_extreme_1y.
  • Additional inputs: Global Industrial Production data, LME Copper Inventory levels.

Self-Healing

  • High-Value Inputs to Add:
    • LME Copper Inventory Data: would improve assessment of physical market supply/demand.
    • Global Industrial Production Data: provides macro context for copper demand drivers.
  • Weaknesses in Provided Inputs:
    • Several CFTC columns are empty in the provided dataframe snippet (e.g., 'Market and Exchange Names'). Concrete fix: Ensure all descriptive CFTC fields are populated for complete context.
